Authors:
Starri Heidmarsson, Cecile Gueidan, Jolanta Maria
Miadlikowska, Francois Lutzoni
Title:
Multi-locus phylogeny supports the placement of Endocarpon
pulvinatum within Staurothele s. str. (lichenised ascomycetes,
Eurotiomycetes, Verrucariaceae)
Keywords:
subfruticose Staurothele, Endocarpon tortuosum,
Verrucariales, mcm7
Abstract:
Within the lichen family Verrucariaceae, the lichen genera
Endocarpon, Willeya and Staurothele are characterised by muriform
ascospores and the presence of algal cells in the hymenium. Endocarpon
thalli are squamulose to subfruticose, whereas Willeya and Staurothele
include only crustose species. Endocarpon pulvinatum, an arctic-alpine
species newly reported for Iceland, is one of the few Endocarpon with a
subfruticose thallus formed by long and narrow erected squamules.
Molecular phylogenetic analyses of four loci (ITS, nrLSU, mtSSU, and
mcm7) newly obtained from E. pulvinatum specimens from Iceland, Finland
and North America does not confirm its current classification within the
mostly squamulose genus Endocarpon, but instead supports its placement
within the crustose genus Staurothele. The new combination Staurothele
pulvinata is therefore proposed here. It includes also E. tortuosum,
which was confirmed as a synonym of E. pulvinatum based on a single
sequence.
